title: Alexander-Arnold left out of England squad, Europa League draw and more: football news – live
summary: Writers are providing updates and insights as the weekend approaches in the top-flight football league. Stay tuned for the latest news and developments in the sport. Don't miss out on the excitement leading into the games!

title: Epping council leader calls for calm after judges rule on asylum seeker hotel – UK politics live
summary: The Home Office and the owner of the Bell Hotel have contested a council injunction aimed at preventing the accommodation of numerous asylum seekers at the hotel. They argue against the council's decision to block their plans. This legal challenge highlights ongoing tensions regarding housing asylum seekers.

title: US Open tennis 2025: Raducanu crashes out to Rybakina and Alcaraz in action – live
summary: Katy Murrells is providing live updates from the third round of an event taking place in New York. Follow her reports for the latest developments and highlights. Stay tuned for real-time information on the progress of the round.

title: Lawyer for Federal Reserve governor targeted by Trump says firing does ‘irreparable harm’ – US politics live
summary: Lisa Cook's attorney is advocating for her to continue in her position until a court issues a ruling. This request comes amidst ongoing legal proceedings regarding her role. The outcome of the court's decision remains pending.

title: Detainees report alleged uprising at ‘Alligator Alcatraz’: ‘A lot of people have bled’
summary: Detainees in Florida allege they were physically assaulted and exposed to tear gas during an incident. However, officials from Florida and ICE have denied these claims. The situation has raised concerns about the treatment of individuals in detention.
